title: Add ElectroBeez logo across site, switch to blue/white professional theme, add contact info, and provide custom domain setup guidance

requirements.text: Add the uploaded ElectroBeez logo image as the company logo in the top navigation/header and also display the same logo in other sections of the landing page (hero and footer).

quotes: Add this image as the company logo and change the website theme like professional which looks cool
Add the logo in the top navigation/header and also in the other sections (hero,footer,etc)

acceptanceCriteria: The header navigation (frontend/src/components/landing/SectionNav.tsx) shows the ElectroBeez logo in place of the current icon/brand mark.
The hero section (frontend/src/components/landing/LandingPage.tsx) includes the ElectroBeez logo in a visually prominent, responsive placement.
The footer section of the landing page includes the ElectroBeez logo (or a compact variant) with appropriate sizing and spacing.
Logo images are referenced as static assets from the frontend (not served from the backend).

requirements.text: Replace the current monochrome theme across the entire site with a professional blue-and-white color palette, updating both light mode and dark mode theme tokens and refactoring component classes as needed to match the new palette consistently.

quotes: switch to a new color palette altogether
The new palette replace the current monochrome theme accross the entire site

acceptanceCriteria: Global theme tokens in frontend/src/index.css are updated from monochrome neutrals to a blue-and-white palette for both :root and .dark variables (background/foreground/primary/secondary/accent/border/ring/etc).

Hard-coded monochrome utility styling in landing components (e.g., zinc/black gradients and text colors in frontend/src/components/landing/LandingPage.tsx and frontend/src/components/landing/SectionNav.tsx) is refactored so the UI consistently reflects the blue-and-white theme.
Primary call-to-action buttons and key accents use the new blue primary color (and remain accessible with sufficient contrast).
No section reverts to the old monochrome look after the change (hero, donate, about, budget, benefits, navigation, footer).

requirements.text: Add the company contact details (email: electrobeezindia@gmail.com, phone: +918638493216) to appropriate sections of the landing page (at minimum: footer; optionally: header), with clickable mailto and tel links.

quotes: Also add electrobeezindia@gmail.com this as EMAIL and +918638493216 as company number

acceptanceCriteria: The footer includes the email and phone number displayed as text and as clickable links (mailto:electrobeezindia@gmail.com and tel:+918638493216).
If contact details are included in the header, they remain responsive (do not overflow on mobile) and are accessible.
The contact details are visible in both light mode and dark mode and match the new blue-and-white palette.

requirements.text: Provide a project documentation page that guides the user through making the deployed site accessible via their custom domain on the Internet Computer (DNS records + boundary node/custom domain configuration), including placeholders for the user’s domain name and deployed canister ID.

quotes: Yes, I want the website to be accessible, Setup my domain

acceptanceCriteria: A new documentation file exists (e.g., DOMAIN_SETUP.md or README section) describing the steps to map a custom domain to an IC canister-hosted website, including what DNS records to set and where to provide the canister ID.
Instructions include explicit placeholders for DOMAIN and CANISTER_ID (without guessing the user’s domain).
Documentation clarifies which steps are external to the codebase (domain registrar/DNS and boundary node configuration) vs. what is in-repo.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (Shadcn components); compose and override via props/classes instead.
Do not modify any immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.frontend.immutablePaths.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; only add backend code if strictly necessary for the requested changes (it is not required for logo/theme/contact updates).
Use English for any user-facing text added or modified.
nonGoals: Implementing an automated DNS/domain registrar integration or programmatically configuring IC boundary nodes from within the app.
Adding new unrelated landing page sections or changing the existing informational content beyond what is required to place the logo, update theme styling, and add the provided contact details.
